text.__SUMMARY__: Begonia baccata is a plant species of the genus Begonia in the family Begoniaceae, first described by Joseph Dalton Hooker in 1866. It is endemic to São Tomé Island, and grows up to 4 metres tall. It closest relative is Begonia crateris, also endemic to São Tomé.
text.External links: Dressler, S.; Schmidt, M. & Zizka, G. (2014). "Begonia baccata". African plants – a Photo Guide. Frankfurt/Main: Forschungsinstitut Senckenberg.
